ARABIC: مَا يُبَدَّلُ ٱلْقَوْلُ لَدَىَّ وَمَآ أَنَا۠ بِظَلَّٰمٍ لِّلْعَبِيدِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: My Word, once given, is not subject to change and I do not wrong My slaves.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: There is no changing of My word, nor am I unjust to My creatures."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: My Word is not changed; and never do I inflict the least wrong upon My servants.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: No word is to be exchanged in My presence. I am not unjust to My servants".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “With Me, the decree does not change, and nor do I oppress the bondmen.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: The sentence that comes from Me cannot be changed, and I am not unjust to the servants."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: My word shall not be changed, nor am I in the least unjust to the servants.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: The Word is not changed with Me; I wrong not My servants.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: The sentence that cometh from Me cannot be changed, and I am in no wise a tyrant unto the slaves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and My word shall not be changed, nor am I unjust to My servants."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: The Word will not be changed in My presence, nor am an oppressor at all Unto My bondmen.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: The word [of judgement] is unalterable with Me, and I am not tyrannical to My servants.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: The Word changes not before Me, and I do not the least injustice to My Servants."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: The Sentence that comes from Me cannot be changed, and I am not unjust (to the least) to the slaves."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: The Word cannot be changed with Me; I do not wrong My worshipers'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: The decree from Me will not be changed, and I am not unjust to the servants.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: The word will not be changed with Me, and never will I be unjust to the servants."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [50:29] The word [that comes] from Me, in this respect, cannot be altered, and I am not unjust to servants’, that I should chastise them without any guilt [on their part] (zallām means dhū zulm, ‘one of injustice’, because of His words, There will be no injustice today [Q. 40:17]);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (The sentence that cometh from Me cannot be changed) My words cannot be changed through lying; and it is also said that this means: My decree concerning My salves will not be changed this Day; and it is also said that this means: words cannot be twisted in My presence, (and I am in nowise a tyrant unto the slaves) such that I would punish them without them having committed a crime.
